pattern.name: Time from peak
pattern.description:
Elapsed time in seconds from the moment, when a numerical attribute reached its maximum/minimum value. In the case of a tie, time from the most recent maximum/minimum is returned.
Note: NumericalColumn can be null and that can cause ties -> avoid nulls. However, ties can still happen -> pick the most recent (the maximum) time value (note that it also deals with ties at temporalColumn level).
Note: It is known to fail on PostgreSQL with timetz ant timestamp target_date (they are not additive).
Note: Does not work on MySQL.
pattern.example: How long ago did the customer transfer the biggest amount.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , DATETONUMBER(DATEDIFF(@baseDate, max(@temporalColumn))) / 86400 AS @columnName FROM (SELECT @base , @temporalColumn , RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY @basePartitionBy ORDER BY @numericalColumn @sortOrder) AS rk FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @numericalColumn IS NOT NULL ) t WHERE rk = 1 GROUP BY @base
